original: JOSEFSON, Sten, Disponent. Ulricehamn, f Uhn 11/3 14 av grhdl E J o Ingeborg Andersson. Studex 33, Gbgs hdlsinsts fackk f stud 34, Höh Fachsch f Wirkerei- u Strickerei-Ind, Chemnitz, 37. Bkprakt i Sv o prakt i trikåind i Tyskl o Schweiz 34—38, disp AB Erik Josefson & Co trikåfabr sed. 38, vkst dir Uhn Tidn AB sed. 43. Styr.led i dessa två AB, led av stdsflm (h) sed. 43 samt dess beredn.utsk, rev.suppl för stadens räkenskaper, 2:e v. ordf S :a Älvsborgs ungsv distr, styr.led Ulms högerfrn, Uhns befälsutbildningsfrn o Ulms Lawntennisklubb. Studieres Tyskl o Schweiz 37—39, Danm, Tyskl, Tjeckoslov, Frankr o Belgien.
translated: JOSEFSON, Sten, Manager. Ulricehamn, born in Uhn on March 11, 1914, to parents E J and Ingeborg Andersson. Studied in 1933, specialized in trade at Gbgs Business Institute in 1934, and attended the Höh Fachschule for Weaving and Knitting Industry in Chemnitz in 1937. Worked as an accountant in Sweden and gained practical experience in the knitwear industry in Germany and Switzerland from 1934 to 1938. Became manager of AB Erik Josefson & Co knitwear factory in 1938 and served as the director of Uhn Tidning AB from 1943. Also served as a board member and chaired the development committee of both companies, auditor for the city's accounts, vice chairman of the 1st Älvsborg Youth District, board member of Ulms Right Front, Uhn's Military Training Association, and Ulms Lawn Tennis Club. Traveled to study in Germany, Switzerland, Denmark, Germany again, Czechoslovakia, France, and Belgium from 1937 to 1939.
